com.flowpowered.cerealization.config

Interface ConfigurationNodeSource

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CommentedConfiguration, Configuration, FileConfiguration
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConfiguration, AbstractConfigurationNodeSource, AnnotatedConfiguration, AnnotatedObjectConfiguration, AnnotatedSubclassConfiguration, CommentedConfigurationNode, ConfigurationHolder, ConfigurationHolderConfiguration, ConfigurationNode, ConfigurationWrapper, IniConfiguration, MapBasedConfiguration, MapConfiguration, StringLoadingIniConfiguration, YamlConfiguration

    public interface ConfigurationNodeSource

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ConfigurationNode addChild(ConfigurationNode node)
      Adds the provided node as a child to this one As with the other methods handling children, this method only works with DIRECT children
      void addChildren(ConfigurationNode... nodes)
      Add the given children.
      ConfigurationNode addNode(String name)
      Adds a new node as a child to this one Will overwrite existing
      ConfigurationNode getChild(String name)
      Gets a child of the current node.
      ConfigurationNode getChild(String name, boolean add)
      Gets a child of the current node.
      Map<String,ConfigurationNode> getChildren()
      Return the children of this node.
      Configuration getConfiguration()
      Returns the configuration this node source is attached to.
      Set<String> getKeys(boolean deep)
      Return the keys in this configuration.
      ConfigurationNode getNode(String... path)
      Get a child node of this node source, going across multiple levels.
      ConfigurationNode getNode(String path)
      Returns the node at the specified child path, splitting by the configuration's path separator.
      String[] getPathElements()
      Returns the elements of the configuration path going to this node source.
      Map<String,Object> getValues()
      Return the raw Object values of this node's children ConfigurationNodes are converted into Map<String, Object>s for the result of this method
      boolean hasChild(String key)
      Returns whether the direct child (not checking children of children, etc) at key exists
      boolean hasChildren()
      Returns whether this node source has children.
      boolean hasNode(String... path)
      Returns whether the node at key exists
      ConfigurationNode removeChild(ConfigurationNode node)
      Remove the specified child from the configuration structure
      ConfigurationNode removeChild(String key)
      Remove the child at the specified path, if any, from the configuration structure

    • Method Detail

      • getChild

        ConfigurationNode getChild(String name)
        Gets a child of the current node. Remember that this returns a DIRECT child, without splitting at the Configuration.getPathSeparator()
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the child
        Returns:
        The ConfigurationNode with the child's path.
        See Also:
        getChild(String, boolean)

      • getChild

        ConfigurationNode getChild(String name,
                           boolean add)
        Gets a child of the current node. Remember that this returns a DIRECT child, without splitting at the Configuration.getPathSeparator()
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the child
        add - Whether to store the configuration to the node structure.
        Returns:
        The ConfigurationNode with the child's path.

      • addChild

        ConfigurationNode addChild(ConfigurationNode node)
        Adds the provided node as a child to this one As with the other methods handling children, this method only works with DIRECT children
        Parameters:
        node - The node to add as a child
        Returns:
        The previous node at the specified path (can be null)

      • addNode

        ConfigurationNode addNode(String name)
        Adds a new node as a child to this one Will overwrite existing
        Parameters:
        name - The path to the node to add
        Returns:
        The previous node at the specified path (can be null)

      • addChildren

        void addChildren(ConfigurationNode... nodes)
        Add the given children. The process for adding children is the same as that for addChild(ConfigurationNode)
        Parameters:
        nodes - The nodes to add
        See Also:
        addChild(ConfigurationNode)

      • removeChild

        ConfigurationNode removeChild(String key)
        Remove the child at the specified path, if any, from the configuration structure
        Parameters:
        key - The name of the child
        Returns:
        The child at the key given, if any

      • removeChild

        ConfigurationNode removeChild(ConfigurationNode node)
        Remove the specified child from the configuration structure
        Parameters:
        node - The node to remove
        Returns:
        null if unsuccessful, otherwise the node passed in

      • getChildren

        Map<String,ConfigurationNode> getChildren()
        Return the children of this node. The returned map is unmodifiable
        Returns:
        This node's children

      • getValues

        Map<String,Object> getValues()
        Return the raw Object values of this node's children ConfigurationNodes are converted into Map<String, Object>s for the result of this method
        Returns:
        The node's children values

      • getKeys

        Set<String> getKeys(boolean deep)
        Return the keys in this configuration. If deep is true, this will also include paths from child nodes, joined by Configuration.getPathSeparator() Keys returned are relative to the current node.
        Parameters:
        deep - Whether to also fetch keys in children nodes of this configuration
        Returns:
        the keys in this configuration

      • getNode

        ConfigurationNode getNode(String path)
        Returns the node at the specified child path, splitting by the configuration's path separator. This can return both direct children and indirect children.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to get a node at
        Returns:
        The node at the specified path
        See Also:
        for more information on how this method behaves. (This is also the method called when a path given contains the path separator)

      • getNode

        ConfigurationNode getNode(String... path)
        Get a child node of this node source, going across multiple levels. If there is no node at the specified path a detached configuration node will be returned, which will be attached to getConfiguration() if its value is set or a child is added.
        Parameters:
        path - The path elements to get to the requested node.
        Returns:
        The child node. Never null.

      • hasChildren

        boolean hasChildren()
        Returns whether this node source has children. This is the same as running getChildren().size() > 0
        Returns:
        whether this node source has children

      • hasChild

        boolean hasChild(String key)
        Returns whether the direct child (not checking children of children, etc) at key exists
        Parameters:
        key - The key to check
        Returns:
        Whether key is a direct child of this node

      • hasNode

        boolean hasNode(String... path)
        Returns whether the node at key exists
        Parameters:
        path - The key to check
        Returns:
        Whether key is a direct child of this node

      • getConfiguration

        Configuration getConfiguration()
        Returns the configuration this node source is attached to. This may return the same object if this ConfigurationNodeSource is a Configuration.
        Returns:
        the attached configuration.

      • getPathElements

        String[] getPathElements()
        Returns the elements of the configuration path going to this node source. Can return an empty array if we are at the root of the tree.
        Returns:
        the elements to here
